title: Wilde Bikes Dark Star Hardtail Can Be Run With a Rigid Fork Too
content:
Wilde Bikes‘ latest bike is the Dark Star hardtail with sliding dropouts and built around 120 or 130 mm suspension fork or you can run it with Wilde’s own Future Proof rigid fork…

Dark Star Quick Hits

  • 120 – 130 mm travel suspension fork
  • Frameset $1,200
  • Deore Complete: $3,600
  • GX AXS T-Type Complete: $5,300
  • Made in Taiwan by ORA
  • BOSS Premium Steel Super Tubes
  • Sliding Dropouts for adjusting wheelbase or single speed operation
  • UDH Compatible
  • 29×2.6” tire clearance
  • Bottle Mounts: two in main triangle on Large and X-Large, one on Small and Medium
  • Three Pack Mounts: Under downtube – all sizes
  • Top Tube Feed Bag Mount
  • Stealth Dropper Routing

Geometry

The Dark Star has a 66.5º headtube angle, a taller bottom bracket height, and adjustable dropouts that allow the rider to change the chainstay length from 425 – 440mm, so it can be fine-tuned to your terrain and riding style.

Future Proof Rigid Fork

A 120 – 130 mm travel hardtail can be run with a rigid fork to add to its versatility, allowing you to swap out the squish in favor of a rack, panniers, or cargo bottle cages. Take it on an overnighter and then swap the suspension fork back on.

Check out more at Wilde Bikes.
